column5: Fishboch confirms what I've often wondered when I first saw those sport track adapters. I see the stress my 8"+ gunwales take with my riggers/track and I can only imagine the damage being caused over time. Tall risers aren't a good solution either unless their to each other or to the gunwales.  This would solve the problem... and since money is no object when it's time to rig out the boat... lol http://berts-tackle.shptron.com/p/8ft-downrigger-board-w-2-6tracks-2-risers-and-2-end-caps?pp=8
well I bought the Traxtech  18 " track for my downriggers with  3  per track, protrack brackets  if the T brackets don't hold I can screw the Traxtech  18 " track right to the gunwales
sure have spent a lot and the boat  hasn't even arrived yet

anyone ever deal with this place R-100 Sport Inc512 Boul Adolphe ChapleauBois-des-Filion (QC)J6Z 1K2  I am trying to buy tracks for my lund from them they tell me they can accept a credit card for special orders and I must use  bank transfer but must give them my  credit card number for Purolator   they gave me the info went to my bank and tried but the bank could not get it to  go through, said tha tbranch is closed...now I am nervous  so what do you know about this business thanks
You can find tracks anywhere else?  That sounds shady, lol
so far it is the only place

If I heard bad stuff about that place it would be the first time. If it'll put your mind at ease and if it's not too late, I can take a run out there and buy them for you and ship them off to you from my place? It's only a 40 minute highway run from my place.
thanks for the offer Roy I will see what they say today
And there my friends, is a great OFC'er Had to say OFC Roy because you are one of a kind from old school Tried typed our old logo but it changes when I hit post, darn. You have a big heart my friend
yup it always amazes me how great the people here are..     so far everything I try to do with this store seems to fall  apart, maybe it was never meant to be
Did you talk to them today, Terry?
You would think he was a newf eh Dave. LOL J/K Roy. YER ONE OF THE GOOD OLE BYES
Awesome Roy !!!! That's why all of us are awesome great to help terry out !!!!!!! I have never heard if that company before ?? What is it an online ordering or what ??????
http://www.r-100sport.ca/en/   Now that I have time ,They seem to be a StarCraft supplier. What are these tracks you talk of? Where yer buying the boat ,cant they help you out?

I am waiting on an answer from them  the are a seller  of http://traxstech.com/       traxstech says they are the only full stock seller of their products and the are in canada they don't have an  on line store but they do ship
That's their problem then. They're not geared up for online sales and they should be. Anyhow, think about it, if you want the stuff, I'll be happy to get it for you.

thanks  I am trying to confirm that they do indeed have everything in stock at the store because their first reply said they did not  if they do have it, also trying to get a courier  to pay for it and pick it up if I pay the courier  up front for everything
OK, I'm on standby then.
Ok thats what yer talking about.  I like the set up Paul has. Not sure the name of the brand  though.
he has wide gunnels and put screws in to Joey's boat......................................LOL I have skinny little ones,   so this seems to be the way to go and no holes to drill
well looks like I got it done with a money order I will post when it all arrives  thanks everyone and Roy for the great offer
Good to hear bud. I got that nylon you were asking about.
great, if we ever get out fishing I will grab it......if a boat show up or the river drops and clears up
No worries, Glad it worked out for you Terry. I hope the stuff is as good as you expect it to be.

Well looks like everything worked out for you. Just saw this post and I did the same thing earlier this spring. I too was looking for a solution for my new Lund. I dealt with these guys strictly through emails. Did the bank transfer thing and was a little skeptical too but everything worked out fine. They had to order some parts before the could fill my order but once they had everything they let me know and it was here in two days. The only problem was the manufacturer's claim. Not sure what boat you have or what application you are trying to setup but I was trying to setup downriggers on my 1775 Impact. Traxtech claimed a 24 inch would be good enough for downriggers. I tried them when the gear arrived and there's just too much torque on the gunnels. I'm getting some custom risers built that will mount to the floor for the riggers and the Traxtech system will be used strictly for my rod holders when trolling for musky.
dang, where  were you yesterday when I needed you..........lol  oh well, ordered now
Walleye central is a great place to ask questions on lunds. Lots of impact owners there. What electRonics are you putting on your new rig?
yeah I read a few posts about these things on Walleye central and people seemed to think they were good but the lund ones were too weak for downriggers
